Package ohos.net

Class VpnProperty

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.net.VpnProperty

  • public class VpnProperty
extends Object
    Provides methods for setting properties of a VPN connection.
    Since:
    3

      A constructor used to create a VpnProperty instance.

    • Method Detail

      • addAddress

        public void addAddress​(String address,
                       int maskLength)
        Adds an IP address for the VPN virtual interface.

        Before calling #setUp(ohos.net.VpnProperty), you must call this method at least once to add an IP address.

        Parameters:
        address - Indicates the IP address to add. Both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are supported.
        maskLength - Indicates the mask length.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if address is invalid.
        Since:
        3

      • addRoute

        public void addRoute​(String address,
                     int maskLength)
        Adds a route with a specified IP address for the VPN virtual interface.
        Parameters:
        address - Indicates the IP address of the route to add. Both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses are supported.
        maskLength - Indicates the mask length.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if address is invalid.
        Since:
        3

      • addAcceptedApplication

        public void addAcceptedApplication​(String applicationName,
                                   Context context)
        Adds an application that is allowed to access this VPN connection.

        If you do not call this method, all applications are allowed to access this VPN connection. If you add some applications via this method, those that are not added still use the default network.

        You can set either applications that are allowed to access a VPN connection or applications that are disallowed, but not both. This means that you cannot call both this method and the addRefusedApplication(java.lang.String, ohos.app.Context) method. If you call both methods, UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        applicationName - Indicates the name of the application to add.
        context - Indicates the application context.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if context is null.
        Since:
        3

      • addRefusedApplication

        public void addRefusedApplication​(String applicationName,
                                  Context context)
                           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Adds an application that is disallowed to access this VPN connection.

        You can set either applications that are allowed to access a VPN connection or applications that are disallowed, but not both. This means that you cannot call both this method and the addAcceptedApplication(java.lang.String, ohos.app.Context) method. If you call both methods, UnsupportedOperationException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        applicationName - Indicates the name of the application to add.
        context - Indicates the application context.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if context is null.
        Since:
        3

      • addDnsAddress

        public void addDnsAddress​(String address)
        Adds the IP address of a DNS server. If it is not added, the default DNS server will be used.
        Parameters:
        address - Indicates the IP address of the DNS server to add.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if address is invalid.
        Since:
        3

      • setMtu

        public void setMtu​(int mtu)
        Sets a maximum transmission unit (MTU) for this VPN connection. If it is not set, the default value will be used.
        Parameters:
        mtu - Indicates the MTU to set.
        Since:
        3

      • setBlock

        public void setBlock​(boolean isBlock)
        Sets whether to enable blocking mode for this VPN connection.
        Parameters:
        isBlock - Specifies whether to enable blocking mode for this VPN connection. The value true means to enable blocking mode, and false (default value) means the opposite.
        Since:
        3
